refnamediv.refpurpose: Sorts the list of triangles that constitutes the BOT primitive to optimize it for raytracing with the specified number of triangles per piece.

refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: Used to sort the list of triangles that constitutes the BOT primitive to optimize it for raytracing with the specified number of triangles per piece. Most BRL-CAD primitives are treated as a single object when a model is being prepared for raytracing, but BOT primitives are normally broken into "pieces" to improve performance. The raytracer normally uses four triangles per piece.

refsection.title: EXAMPLES
refsection.para: The example shows the use of the bot_face_sort command to sort the list of triangles that constitutes the BOT primitive to optimize it for raytracing.

example.title: Sorting the faces of two primitives (each having four triangles per piece) to optimize them for raytracing

listitem.para: The faces of bot1 and bot2 to optimize them for raytracing with four triangles per piece.
